description: Upgrade the roofing insulation; new single ply membrane roof covering to flat roof areas; raising of internal facing parapet brick walls; new Heritage style rooflights and lanterns to replace existing; repairs to masonry, timber windows, metal windows, brickwork steam clean to non-camouflaged areas; renewal of sash cords; windows to be upgraded with secondary sealed window unit, secondary glazing installed; rainwater goods to be retained and refurbished & installation of wire bird protection system.
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.</p><p>REASON: In accordance with Section 17 (1) (b) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and to ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>All existing historic features including, but not limited to, chimney pieces, plasterwork, architraves, panelling, doors, staircase balustrading shall remain undisturbed in their existing position and shall be fully protected during the course of works on site, unless specifically authorised otherwise on the drawings hereby approved.&nbsp; The development and works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: In accordance with Section 17 (1) (b) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and to ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023,</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of construction, details of the proposed all new and replacement roof windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The required details shall include a manufacturer’s specification and illustration, together with a 1:20 scale elevation drawing showing the glazing pattern and 1:5 scale vertical and horizontal cross section drawings showing the location of the rooflight in relation to the roof structure and covering, the frames, the dimensions of the glazing, the profile and dimensions of the glazing bars and spacers (if any).&nbsp; The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>All external brick facing shall match that of the existing listed building or listed wall in respect of type, size, colour, face bond, coursing, jointing, profile and texture, unless otherwise first approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>All new and replacement external rainwater and soil pipes shall be of traditional design, formed in cast iron/cast aluminium and painted black.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>
